      • abs

        public Var abs()
        Description copied from interface: Var
        Returns a new Var that is constrained to be the absolute value of this variable.
        Specified by:

        Returns:

      • addPropagator

        public void addPropagator(Propagator propagator,
                          PropagationEvent event)
        This method associates a custom Propagator with an "event" related to changes in the domain of a constrained variable "var". It forces the solver to keep an eye on these events and invoke the Propagator "propagator" when these events actually occur. When such events occur, the Propagator's method propagate() will be executed.
        Parameters:
        propagator - the Propagator we wish to associate with events on the variable.
        event - the events that will trigger the invocation of the Propagator.

      • getDomainSize

        public int getDomainSize()

      • setDomainType

        public void setDomainType(DomainType type)
        Changes the domain type of this variable. Setting domain type AFTER a variable was created allows to take into consideration posted constraints and other problem state specific information. To take advantage of such domain type as DOMAIN_AUTOMATIC this method should be overloaded by an implementation solver
        Specified by:
        setDomainType in interface Var
        Parameters:
        type -

      • sqr

        public Var sqr()
        Returns a new Var that is constrained to be the product of this variable and itself, i.e. this * this.
        Specified by:
        sqr in interface Var
        Returns:
        a Var that represents: this * this.
